lines.text: You know, George, I think you waste your time with the wrong sort of women.
I never waste my time with any women.
I quite believe that.
Ladies and gentlemen, I declare this bizarre well and truly laid.
Never have so much owed so many to so little.
Good morning!
Good morning.
Haven't we met somewhere before?
I don't think so.
I've got a wonderful memory for faces.
Well, I haven't, but I think I'd remember yours. I mean...
I was looking for you.
Oh, why?
This card just came for you. Swiss stamp and a very curious message.
That's pretty cool nerve. Do you always read other people's letters?
Certainly not. This isn't a letter. It's a postcard. Postcards are fair game.
Hello!
I've, uh, brought your supper.
Ah, that's very decent of you.
Well, they're shorthanded and I thought that I'd...

[interrupting]
Find Helen here, eh? Well, bad luck. She's gone.
[Alan starts to leave]
Oh, don't run away.
I've got work to do!
More domestic duties?
You can always tell a real butler. Butlers' faces are white. If they pinch the boss's port, they're red. Yours is brown.
There is somebody supposed to be looking after you, isn't there?
Mmm. That butler of yours.
Yes. Well, would you mind going back and being looked after again?
Now, I want you to enjoy yourself. Do anything you like, but don't touch things. Do you hear? Ha-ha-ha. Never mind, never mind. Forget all about what a nuisance you are.
And we are proud to have as our auctioneer today a real, live spitwire - fire - pilot, Wing Lieutenant Perry, CFD.
